snippet: A last-minute House attempt at relief for drought-stricken farmers was one of a series of measures that fell victim to partisan fighting, and infighting, in recent weeks.
abstract: Members of Congress depart for August recess, leaving behind pile of unfinished legislation as they go home to campaign for re-election; after refusing to consider a five-year farm measure, House Republican leaders pass short-term $383 million package of loans and grants for livestock producers and limited number of farmers; Democrats balk over the way the farm legislation has been handled and some Republicans object to the costs.
lead_paragraph: A last-minute House attempt at relief for drought-stricken farmers was one of a series of measures that fell victim to partisan fighting, and infighting, in recent weeks.

headline.seo: House Passes Short-Term Farm Relief Bill
headline.main: Pile of Bills Is Left Behind as Congress Goes to Campaign
headline.print_headline: Bills Unfinished, Congress Breaks For Campaigning
